Eckhart Arnold, Ph.D (philosophy), M.A. (political science) is a research assistant in the philosophy & economics program at the University of Bayreuth. He has published on various topics of philosophy and political science, including evolutionary computer simulations, political theology and intercultural ethics. Currently he is working on the link between anti-liberalism and theological conceptions of politics. He edited the ontos-Volume “Hans Kelsen: A New Science of Politics.”
